Question.Text: A 53-Year-Old Man from Malawi presents to a local hospital with a 3-month history of productive cough, whitish sputum, night sweats and weight loss.  he is newly diagnosed with HIV-infection and advanced immunosuppression.

Answer: Pulmonary tuberculosis (HIV-associated) - The newly HIV-positive patient with advanced immunosuppression presents with chronic productive cough, night sweats, and significant weight loss over 3 months in Malawi. The images show emaciated patient with wasting and acid-fast bacilli (Mycobacterium tuberculosis) on sputum smear. TB is the leading cause of death in HIV-positive patients and often presents with advanced cavitary disease and severe constitutional symptoms.
